intro: Henckelia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf heather, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in the Andes region of Ecuador and Peru. This plant is characterized by its variable leaf morphology, with leaves that can be either linear or ovate depending on the environmental conditions. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, blooming in the spring and early summer.
